newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends easier on demand for dollar.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends easier on demand for dollar.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka closed easier at 42.2200/42.2400 to the dollar in interbank trading compared with 42.2000/42.2300, previously, dealers said. .
Dealers said although the taka recovered slightly after opening at 42.2220/42.2420, it remained mostly weaker due to dollar short-covering by banks ahead of Moslem Friday weekend.
"Besides, the banks were buying dollars to maintain long positions in anticiaption of downward adjustment of local unit by the central bank," said one dealer with a foreign bank.
Dealers said interbank call money rates closed unchanged at 4.25 percent to 4.75 percent.
